meanings.definition: A condition that is the consequence of a previous disease or injury.
meanings.sent1: The sequela of the accident was a limp that lasted for months.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that memory loss was a sequela of the head injury.
meanings.sent3: The sequela of eating too much cake was a stomachache that lasted all night.
meanings.sent4: Her sequela of heartbreak was a fear of falling in love again.
meanings.sent5: The sequela of the storm was a flooded basement that required days to clean up.

meanings.definition: A result or effect that follows something else.
meanings.sent1: The sequela of skipping breakfast was a growling stomach during the morning meeting.
meanings.sent2: The sequela of the heavy rain was a beautiful rainbow in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The sequela of the prank was laughter that echoed through the entire office.
meanings.sent4: His sequela of hard work was a promotion to a higher position in the company.
meanings.sent5: The sequela of kindness is often more kindness in return from others.
